what: What is the Quality of Care Index (QCI)?
title: Getting Started with qci
text: Quality Care Index (QCI) composite metric derived Global Burden Disease (GBD) study data. uses Principal Component Analysis (PCA) four epidemiological ratios produce single score (0-100) country, year, sex combination. Higher scores indicate better quality care. four component ratios : MIR: Mortality--Incidence Ratio (Deaths / Incidence) YLLtoYLD: Years Life Lost Years Lived Disability ratio DALtoPER: DALY--Prevalence Ratio PERtoINC: Prevalence--Incidence Ratio

title: Getting Started with qci
code: library(qci)

title: Getting Started with qci
text: package includes sample GBD data demonstration:
code: data(sample_gbd) head(sample_gbd[, c("location_name", "measure_name", "metric_name", "year", "val")]) #>   location_name                       measure_name metric_name year      val #> 1         Japan YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 2.674029 #> 2         Japan YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 2.779096 #> 3         Japan YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 2.723352 #> 4         China YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 3.612208 #> 5         China YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 4.225407 #> 6         China YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)        Rate 1990 3.910120

title: Getting Started with qci
text: qci_pipeline() function runs entire analysis one call: result list three elements:
code: result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd, verbose = FALSE) #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). names(result) #> [1] "wide"        "long"        "pca_details"

title: Getting Started with qci
text: Wide format - one row per location/year/sex: PCA details - variance explained first principal component:
code: result$wide[, .(location_name, year, sex_name, qci_score)] |>   head(10) #> Key: <location_name, year, sex_name> #>     location_name  year sex_name qci_score #>            <char> <int>   <char>     <num> #>  1:     Australia  1990     Both  99.96851 #>  2:     Australia  1990   Female  99.96648 #>  3:     Australia  1990     Male  99.94012 #>  4:     Australia  2005     Both 100.00000 #>  5:     Australia  2005   Female  99.91433 #>  6:     Australia  2005     Male  99.97438 #>  7:     Australia  2019     Both  99.98164 #>  8:     Australia  2019   Female 100.00000 #>  9:     Australia  2019     Male 100.00000 #> 10:        Brazil  1990     Both   0.00000 result$pca_details #>   sex_name         age_name variance_explained_pc1 eigenvalue_pc1 #> 1     Both Age-standardized               74.05598       2.962239 #> 2   Female Age-standardized               75.66964       3.026785 #> 3     Male Age-standardized               73.20481       2.928192 #>   n_observations #> 1             27 #> 2             27 #> 3             27

title: Getting Started with qci
text: Compute GDR (Female QCI / Male QCI):
code: gdr <- qci_gdr(result$wide) head(gdr[, .(location_name, year, qci_female, qci_male, gdr, gdr_category)]) #>    location_name  year qci_female  qci_male       gdr gdr_category #>           <char> <int>      <num>     <num>     <num>       <char> #> 1:         China  1990   19.01955  2.425957 7.8400189         high #> 2:         China  2005   53.22120 55.349268 0.9615519        equal #> 3:         China  2019   83.53537 92.311271 0.9049315          low #> 4:         Japan  1990   98.90032 98.579658 1.0032528        equal #> 5:         Japan  2005   98.57262 99.512890 0.9905512        equal #> 6:         Japan  2019   94.94150 99.428526 0.9548718        equal

title: Getting Started with qci
text: Trend plot:  Distribution plot:
code: plot_qci_trend(result$wide,                locations = unique(result$wide$location_name)[1:3]) plot_qci_distribution(result$wide, years = c(1990, 2019))

title: Getting Started with qci
text: Export data GBD Results Tool Ensure include 6 measures: Deaths, Incidence, Prevalence, DALYs, YLLs, YLDs Include Rate Number metrics Load process:
code: # Single file result <- qci_pipeline("path/to/gbd_export.csv")  # Multiple files (merged automatically) result <- qci_pipeline(c("file1.csv", "file2.csv", "file3.csv"))

title: Getting Started with qci
text: control, use individual functions:
code: # 1. Load gbd <- qci_load("path/to/gbd_data.csv")  # 2. Clean and reshape cleaned <- qci_clean(gbd)  # 3. Compute ratios with_ratios <- qci_ratios(cleaned$wide_number)  # 4. Run PCA pca_result <- qci_pca(with_ratios)  # 5. Gender disparity gdr <- qci_gdr(pca_result$data)  # 6. Export qci_export_csv(pca_result$data, "qci_results.csv")

what: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: Quality Care Index Global Burden Disease Studies qci provides complete, reproducible pipeline calculating Quality Care Index (QCI) Global Burden Disease (GBD) study data. QCI composite country-level metric (0–100) derived via Principal Component Analysis quantifies healthcare quality disease condition.

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: QCI computed four epidemiological ratios derived GBD estimates: ratios combined via PCA, normalized 0–100, inverted higher scores = better quality care. analysis stratified sex age group, preserves GBD uncertainty intervals throughout. full methodology details, see QCI Protocol (Mohammadi et al., 2020).

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
code: # Install from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("choxos/qci")

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
code: library(qci)  # Run the complete pipeline on a GBD CSV export result <- qci_pipeline("path/to/gbd_export.csv")  # Or use bundled sample data result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd)  # View QCI scores result$wide[, .(location_name, year, sex_name, qci_score)]

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: Export data GBD Results Tool 6 measures (Deaths, Incidence, Prevalence, DALYs, YLLs, YLDs). Multiple CSV files automatically merged:
code: result <- qci_pipeline(c("gbd_part1.csv", "gbd_part2.csv", "gbd_part3.csv"))

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
code: gdr <- qci_gdr(result$wide) gdr[year == 2019, .(location_name, qci_female, qci_male, gdr, gdr_category)]

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
code: # Choropleth map map_data <- merge_location_type(result$wide) plot_qci_map(map_data, years = c(1990, 2019))  # Gender disparity map gdr_data <- merge_location_type(qci_gdr(result$wide)) plot_gdr_map(gdr_data, years = c(1990, 2019))  # Time series plot_qci_trend(result$wide, locations = c("Japan", "Brazil", "Nigeria"))  # Distribution comparison plot_qci_distribution(result$wide, years = c(1990, 2019))  # Male vs Female scatter plot_qci_scatter(map_data, year = 2019, color_by = "type")

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: full control processing step:
code: # 1. Load GBD CSV data gbd <- qci_load("gbd_export.csv")  # 2. Clean, filter, and reshape cleaned <- qci_clean(gbd)  # 3. Compute epidemiological ratios with_ratios <- qci_ratios(cleaned$wide_number)  # 4. Run PCA and compute QCI scores pca_result <- qci_pca(with_ratios)  # 5. Gender Disparity Ratio gdr <- qci_gdr(pca_result$data)  # 6. Export results qci_export_csv(pca_result$data, "qci_results.csv") qci_export_dta(pca_result$data, "qci_results.dta")

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: GBD CSV exports must include: Measures: Deaths, Incidence, Prevalence, DALYs, YLDs, YLLs Metrics: Rate (required); Number Percent optional Columns: measure_name, location_id, location_name, sex_name, age_name, metric_name, year, val, upper, lower package works GBD cause (e.g., cancers, cardiovascular diseases, infectious diseases).

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: use package research, please cite: Sofi-Mahmudi (2026). qci: Quality Care Index Global Burden Disease Data. R package version 0.1.0. https://choxos.github.io/qci/ QCI protocol: Mohammadi E, Ghasemi E, Saeedi Moghaddam S, Yoosefi M, Ghanbari , Ahmadi N, Masinaei M, Roshani S, Ebrahimi N, Rouhifard Khalilabad M, Nasserinejad M, Azadnajafabad S, Mohajer B, Mohebi F, Rezaei N, Mokdad , Larijani B, Farzadfar F (2020). “Quality Care Index (QCI).” protocols.io. doi: 10.17504/protocols.io.bprjmm4n

title: qci - Quality of Care Index for GBD Studies
text: Ahmad Sofi-Mahmudi ()

what: Create long format from wide QCI data — .create_long_format
title: Create long format from wide QCI data — .create_long_format
text: Create long format wide QCI data

title: Create long format from wide QCI data — .create_long_format
code: .create_long_format(wide_data)

title: Create long format from wide QCI data — .create_long_format
text: wide_data Wide format data.table.

title: Create long format from wide QCI data — .create_long_format
text: Long format data.table.

title: Location type metadata — location_type
text: Mapping GBD location identifiers location type (Country, Region, World Bank Income Level, SDI, etc.) ISO3 codes. Used filter data country-level observations join ISO3 codes mapping.

title: Location type metadata — location_type
code: location_type

title: Location type metadata — location_type
text: data.frame columns: location_id Integer. GBD location identifier. location_name Character. GBD location name. type Character. Location classification (e.g., "Country", "Regions", "SDI", "World Bank Income Levels"). iso3 Character. ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code (NA non-country locations).

what: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
title: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
text: Joins data location_type dataset optionally filters countries .

title: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
code: merge_location_type(data, loc_types = NULL, keep_types = "Country")

title: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
text: data data.frame location_name column. loc_types data.frame location_name, type, iso3 columns. Defaults bundled location_type dataset. keep_types Character vector types keep. Default "Country". Use NULL keep types.

title: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
text: data.frame type iso3 columns added, filtered requested types.

title: Merge with location type metadata — merge_location_type
code: data(sample_gbd) result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) #> ℹ Cleaning and reshaping data... #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ Computing epidemiological ratios... #> ℹ Running PCA... #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ Creating long format output... #> ✔ QCI pipeline complete. merged <- merge_location_type(result$wide)

title: Normalize scores to 0-100 range — normalize_0_100
text: Applies min-max normalization: 100 * (x - min(x)) / (max(x) - min(x)).

title: Normalize scores to 0-100 range — normalize_0_100
code: normalize_0_100(x)

title: Normalize scores to 0-100 range — normalize_0_100
text: x Numeric vector.

title: Normalize scores to 0-100 range — normalize_0_100
text: Numeric vector scaled [0, 100].

what: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
title: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
text: Create choropleth map Gender Disparity Ratio

title: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
code: plot_gdr_map(   data,   years = NULL,   breaks = c(0, 0.5, 0.95, 1.05, 2, Inf),   labels = c("< 0.5", "[0.5, 0.95)", "[0.95, 1.05]", "(1.05, 2.0]", "> 2.0"),   colors = c("#878787", "#b7b7b7", "#64c2a5", "#b1abd0", "#7f74ac"),   title = NULL,   legend_title = "Age-standardized GDR" )

title: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
text: data data.frame least: iso3, gdr, optionally year. Use merge_location_type() add iso3 qci_gdr() output. years Integer vector. Default NULL (). breaks Numeric vector GDR breakpoints. Default c(0, 0.5, 0.95, 1.05, 2.0, Inf). labels Character vector labels GDR bins. Default c("< 0.5", "[0.5, 0.95)", "[0.95, 1.05]", "(1.05, 2.0]", "> 2.0"). colors Character vector 5 colors. Default grey--purple scale. title Character. Default NULL (auto-generated). legend_title Character. Default "Age-standardized GDR".

title: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Create a choropleth map of Gender Disparity Ratio — plot_gdr_map
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) gdr <- qci_gdr(result$wide) gdr_map <- merge_location_type(gdr) plot_gdr_map(gdr_map, years = c(1990, 2019)) } # }

what: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
title: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
text: Creates density plots comparing Male Female QCI score distributions. Supports comparing across two time points.

title: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
code: plot_qci_distribution(   data,   score_col = "qci_score",   years = NULL,   sex = c("Male", "Female"),   age = "Age-standardized",   alpha = 0.5,   colors = c(Male = "skyblue4", Female = "firebrick") )

title: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
text: data data.frame QCI results. Can wide format (pipeline output) long format. score_col Character. Column name containing score plot. Default "qci_score". years Integer vector 1 2 years compare. Default NULL (years overlaid). sex Character vector sex categories. Default c("Male", "Female"). age Character. Age group. Default "Age-standardized". alpha Numeric. Transparency density fills. Default 0.5. colors Named character vector. Default c(Male = "skyblue4", Female = "firebrick").

title: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot QCI score distributions by sex — plot_qci_distribution
code: data(sample_gbd) result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) #> ℹ Cleaning and reshaping data... #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ Computing epidemiological ratios... #> ℹ Running PCA... #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ Creating long format output... #> ✔ QCI pipeline complete. plot_qci_distribution(result$wide, years = c(1990, 2019))

what: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
title: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
text: Plots QCI scores world map using natural earth geometries. Supports faceting year custom color scales quantile-based breaks.

title: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
code: plot_qci_map(   data,   fill_var = "qci_score",   years = NULL,   sex = "Both",   age = "Age-standardized",   n_quantiles = 5,   colors = c("#a40227", "#f56c42", "#dfbf72", "#a7da68", "#1a9850"),   title = NULL,   legend_title = "Age-standardized QCI (%)" )

title: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
text: data data.frame least: iso3, qci_score (column specified fill_var), optionally year faceting. Use merge_location_type() add iso3 pipeline output. fill_var Character. Column name map fill color. Default "qci_score". years Integer vector years display. Default NULL (). sex Character. Sex filter . Default "". age Character. Age group filter . Default "Age-standardized". n_quantiles Integer. Number quantile bins color scale. Default 5. colors Character vector colors quantile bins, lowest highest. Default red--green scale. title Character. Plot title. Default NULL (auto-generated). legend_title Character. Legend title. Default "Age-standardized QCI (%)".

title: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Create a choropleth map of QCI scores — plot_qci_map
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) map_data <- merge_location_type(result$wide) plot_qci_map(map_data, years = c(1990, 2019)) } # }

what: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
title: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
text: Creates scatter plot Male QCI x-axis Female QCI y-axis, colored region custom grouping. Includes diagonal reference line (y = x).

title: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
code: plot_qci_scatter(   data,   score_var = "qci_score",   year,   age = "Age-standardized",   color_by = NULL,   point_size = 2,   show_diagonal = TRUE )

title: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
text: data data.frame columns: location_name, qci_score (column specified score_var), sex_name, year, age_name. include Male Female rows. score_var Character. Column name score. Default "qci_score". year Integer. Single year plot. Required. age Character. Default "Age-standardized". color_by Character. Column name color points (e.g., "type"). Default NULL (color grouping). point_size Numeric. Point size. Default 2. show_diagonal Logical. Show y = x line. Default TRUE.

title: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Scatter plot of Male vs Female QCI by region — plot_qci_scatter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) map_data <- merge_location_type(result$wide) plot_qci_scatter(map_data, year = 2019, color_by = "type") } # }

what: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
title: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
text: Creates line plots QCI years, stratified sex. multiple locations present, automatically facets location readability.

title: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
code: plot_qci_trend(   data,   locations = NULL,   sex = c("Male", "Female", "Both"),   age = "Age-standardized",   colors = c(Male = "skyblue4", Female = "firebrick", Both = "grey30"),   facet_by = NULL,   free_y = FALSE )

title: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
text: data data.frame columns: year, qci_score, sex_name, location_name, age_name. locations Character vector location names. Default NULL (). sex Character vector sex categories include. Default c("Male", "Female", ""). age Character. Default "Age-standardized". colors Named character vector. Default c(Male = "skyblue4", Female = "firebrick", = "grey30"). facet_by Character. Column facet . NULL (default), auto-facets location_name one location present. Set FALSE disable auto-faceting. free_y Logical. Free y-axis scales facets. Default FALSE.

title: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot QCI trends over time — plot_qci_trend
code: data(sample_gbd) result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) #> ℹ Cleaning and reshaping data... #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ Computing epidemiological ratios... #> ℹ Running PCA... #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ Creating long format output... #> ✔ QCI pipeline complete. plot_qci_trend(result$wide)

what: qci: Quality of Care Index from Global Burden of Disease Data — qci-package
title: qci: Quality of Care Index from Global Burden of Disease Data — qci-package
text: Calculates Quality Care Index (QCI) Global Burden Disease (GBD) study data. QCI composite metric derived via Principal Component Analysis four epidemiological ratios: Mortality--Incidence (MIR), YLL--YLD, DALY--Prevalence, Prevalence--Incidence. Provides complete pipeline raw GBD CSV exports normalized country-level scores, gender disparity analysis, publication-ready visualizations including choropleth maps.

title: qci: Quality of Care Index from Global Burden of Disease Data — qci-package
text: Maintainer: Ahmad Sofi-Mahmudi ahmad.sofimahmudi@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

what: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
title: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
text: Performs standard data preparation steps: Remove specified location IDs (e.g., 533 Melanesia aggregate) Standardize measure names (shorten verbose GBD names) Filter specified countries using location_type metadata Filter specified age categories Filter Rate metric reshape wide format

title: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
code: qci_clean(   data,   loc_types = NULL,   keep_types = "Country",   age_categories = "Age-standardized",   exclude_location_ids = 533L )

title: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
text: data data.frame data.table raw GBD data (output qci_load()). loc_types data.frame location metadata. NULL, uses bundled location_type dataset. keep_types Character vector location types retain. Default "Country". Use NULL skip location type filtering. age_categories Character vector age groups include. Default "Age-standardized". exclude_location_ids Integer vector location_ids exclude. Default 533.

title: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
text: list two data.table elements: wide_rate Wide-format data Rate metric, used final merged output. wide_number Wide-format data used ratio/PCA computation. Uses Rate data (ratios rates equal ratios numbers). columns like val_Deaths, val_Incidence, upper_Deaths, lower_Deaths, etc.

title: Clean and filter GBD data for QCI computation — qci_clean
code: data(sample_gbd) cleaned <- qci_clean(sample_gbd) #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. names(cleaned) #> [1] "wide_rate"   "wide_number"

what: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
title: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
text: Writes QCI results CSV file.

title: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
code: qci_export_csv(data, file)

title: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
text: data data.frame QCI results. file Character. Output file path.

title: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
text: Invisible file path (piping).

title: Export QCI results to CSV — qci_export_csv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) qci_export_csv(result$wide, "qci_results.csv") } # }

what: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
title: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
text: Writes QCI results Stata .dta file via haven::write_dta(). Requires haven package.

title: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
code: qci_export_dta(data, file)

title: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
text: data data.frame. file Character. Output file path.

title: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
text: Invisible file path.

title: Export QCI results to Stata DTA format — qci_export_dta
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) qci_export_dta(result$wide, "qci_results.dta") } # }

title: Calculate Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) — qci_gdr
text: Computes GDR = Female QCI / Male QCI location, year, age group. Classifies ratio categories based thresholds.

title: Calculate Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) — qci_gdr
code: qci_gdr(data, low_threshold = 0.95, high_threshold = 1.05)

title: Calculate Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) — qci_gdr
text: data data.frame data.table containing minimum: location_name (location_id), year, sex_name, age_name, qci_score. Typically data element qci_pca() output, wide element qci_pipeline(). low_threshold Numeric. GDR value classified "low". Default 0.95. high_threshold Numeric. GDR value classified "high". Default 1.05.

title: Calculate Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) — qci_gdr
text: data.table columns: location_id, location_name, year, age_name, qci_female, qci_male, gdr, gdr_category.

title: Calculate Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) — qci_gdr
code: data(sample_gbd) result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) #> ℹ Cleaning and reshaping data... #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ Computing epidemiological ratios... #> ℹ Running PCA... #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ Creating long format output... #> ✔ QCI pipeline complete. gdr <- qci_gdr(result$wide) head(gdr) #> Key: <location_id, location_name, year, age_name> #>    location_id location_name  year         age_name qci_female  qci_male #>          <int>        <char> <int>           <char>      <num>     <num> #> 1:           6         China  1990 Age-standardized   19.01955  2.425957 #> 2:           6         China  2005 Age-standardized   53.22120 55.349268 #> 3:           6         China  2019 Age-standardized   83.53537 92.311271 #> 4:          67         Japan  1990 Age-standardized   98.90032 98.579658 #> 5:          67         Japan  2005 Age-standardized   98.57262 99.512890 #> 6:          67         Japan  2019 Age-standardized   94.94150 99.428526 #>          gdr gdr_category #>        <num>       <char> #> 1: 7.8400189         high #> 2: 0.9615519        equal #> 3: 0.9049315          low #> 4: 1.0032528        equal #> 5: 0.9905512        equal #> 6: 0.9548718        equal

title: Load GBD CSV data — qci_load
text: Reads one GBD CSV export files combines single data.table. Handles row-number column GBD exports include first unnamed column. Uses data.table::fread() speed.

title: Load GBD CSV data — qci_load
code: qci_load(files, ...)

title: Load GBD CSV data — qci_load
text: files Character vector file paths GBD CSV exports. Can single file multiple files row-bound. ... Additional arguments passed data.table::fread().

title: Load GBD CSV data — qci_load
text: data.table standard GBD columns: measure_id, measure_name, location_id, location_name, sex_id, sex_name, age_id, age_name, cause_id, cause_name, metric_id, metric_name, year, val, upper, lower.

title: Load GBD CSV data — qci_load
code: f <- system.file("extdata", "sample_gbd_data.csv", package = "qci") gbd <- qci_load(f) #> ℹ Loaded 486 rows from 1 file(s). head(gbd) #>    measure_id                       measure_name location_id location_name #>         <int>                             <char>       <int>        <char> #> 1:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)          67         Japan #> 2:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)          67         Japan #> 3:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)          67         Japan #> 4:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)           6         China #> 5:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)           6         China #> 6:          3 YLDs (Years Lived with Disability)           6         China #>    sex_id sex_name age_id         age_name cause_id       cause_name metric_id #>     <int>   <char>  <int>           <char>    <int>           <char>     <int> #> 1:      1     Male     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #> 2:      2   Female     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #> 3:      3     Both     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #> 4:      1     Male     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #> 5:      2   Female     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #> 6:      3     Both     27 Age-standardized      644 Orofacial clefts         3 #>    metric_name  year      val    upper    lower #>         <char> <int>    <num>    <num>    <num> #> 1:        Rate  1990 2.674029 3.940510 1.640714 #> 2:        Rate  1990 2.779096 4.130920 1.715965 #> 3:        Rate  1990 2.723352 4.026659 1.692504 #> 4:        Rate  1990 3.612208 5.409820 2.235131 #> 5:        Rate  1990 4.225407 6.288380 2.609528 #> 6:        Rate  1990 3.910120 5.860485 2.417979

what: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
title: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
text: Runs Principal Component Analysis four QCI ratios, stratified sex age subgroups. Extracts PC1, normalizes 0-100, inverts (100 - score) higher values indicate better quality care.

title: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
code: qci_pca(   data,   ratio_cols = c("MIR", "YLLtoYLD", "DALtoPER", "PERtoINC"),   group_by = c("sex_name", "age_name"),   ncp = 5,   scale.unit = TRUE )

title: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
text: data data.table four ratio columns (MIR, YLLtoYLD, DALtoPER, PERtoINC) plus grouping columns sex_name age_name. Typically output qci_ratios(). ratio_cols Character vector column names PCA input. Default c("MIR", "YLLtoYLD", "DALtoPER", "PERtoINC"). group_by Character vector columns stratify PCA . Default c("sex_name", "age_name"). ncp Integer. Number principal components compute. Default 5 (FactoMineR default). PC1 used QCI. scale.unit Logical. Whether scale variables unit variance PCA. Default TRUE.

title: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
text: list two elements: data input data.table new qci_score column containing 0-100 inverted PCA score. pca_details data.frame one row per subgroup, containing columns: sex_name, age_name, variance_explained_pc1, eigenvalue_pc1, n_observations.

title: Compute QCI scores via PCA — qci_pca
code: data(sample_gbd) cleaned <- qci_clean(sample_gbd) #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. with_ratios <- qci_ratios(cleaned$wide_number) result <- qci_pca(with_ratios) #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). head(result$data[, .(location_name, year, sex_name, qci_score)]) #>    location_name  year sex_name qci_score #>           <char> <int>   <char>     <num> #> 1:         China  1990     Both 11.209011 #> 2:         China  1990   Female 19.019548 #> 3:         China  1990     Male  2.425957 #> 4:         China  2005     Both 53.875599 #> 5:         China  2005   Female 53.221197 #> 6:         China  2005     Male 55.349268

what: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
text: convenience function chains processing steps: load (optional) -> clean -> compute ratios -> PCA -> merge Rate data -> create long format output.

title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
code: qci_pipeline(   data,   loc_types = NULL,   keep_types = "Country",   age_categories = "Age-standardized",   exclude_location_ids = 533L,   ratio_cols = c("MIR", "YLLtoYLD", "DALtoPER", "PERtoINC"),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
text: data data.frame raw GBD data. character vector file paths, qci_load() called first. loc_types Location type metadata. NULL uses bundled dataset. keep_types Character vector location types. Default "Country". age_categories Character vector age groups. Default "Age-standardized". exclude_location_ids Integer vector. Default 533. ratio_cols Character vector ratio column names PCA. Default c("MIR", "YLLtoYLD", "DALtoPER", "PERtoINC"). verbose Logical. Print progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
text: list elements: wide data.table wide format. Contains Rate columns, Number columns (suffixed _Number), 4 ratios, qci_score. long data.table long format columns: location_id, location_name, year, sex_name, age_name, measure, value, upper, lower. pca_details data.frame variance explained per subgroup.

title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
text: primary user-facing function computing QCI raw GBD data.

title: Run the complete QCI pipeline — qci_pipeline
code: data(sample_gbd) result <- qci_pipeline(sample_gbd) #> ℹ Cleaning and reshaping data... #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. #> ℹ Computing epidemiological ratios... #> ℹ Running PCA... #> ℹ PCA done for "Both / Age-standardized": 74.1% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Female / Age-standardized": 75.7% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ PCA done for "Male / Age-standardized": 73.2% variance explained (n=27). #> ℹ Creating long format output... #> ✔ QCI pipeline complete. head(result$wide[, .(location_name, year, sex_name, qci_score)]) #> Key: <location_name, year, sex_name> #>    location_name  year sex_name qci_score #>           <char> <int>   <char>     <num> #> 1:     Australia  1990     Both  99.96851 #> 2:     Australia  1990   Female  99.96648 #> 3:     Australia  1990     Male  99.94012 #> 4:     Australia  2005     Both 100.00000 #> 5:     Australia  2005   Female  99.91433 #> 6:     Australia  2005     Male  99.97438

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
text: Computes four epidemiological ratios form basis QCI: MIR = Deaths / Incidence (Mortality--Incidence Ratio) YLLtoYLD = YLLs / YLDs (YLL--YLD Ratio) DALtoPER = DALYs / Prevalence (DALY--Prevalence Ratio) PERtoINC = Prevalence / Incidence (Prevalence--Incidence Ratio)

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
code: qci_ratios(wide_number)

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
text: wide_number data.table wide format Number metric (wide_number element qci_clean()).

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
text: input data.table 12 new columns appended: MIR, lower_MIR, upper_MIR, YLLtoYLD, lower_YLLtoYLD, upper_YLLtoYLD, DALtoPER, lower_DALtoPER, upper_DALtoPER, PERtoINC, lower_PERtoINC, upper_PERtoINC.

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
text: ratio computed point estimates (val), upper, lower uncertainty bounds. Inf NaN values division zero replaced NA.

title: Calculate QCI component ratios — qci_ratios
code: data(sample_gbd) cleaned <- qci_clean(sample_gbd) #> ✔ Cleaned data: 9 locations, 3 years. with_ratios <- qci_ratios(cleaned$wide_number) head(with_ratios[, .(location_name, year, MIR, YLLtoYLD, DALtoPER, PERtoINC)]) #>    location_name  year        MIR  YLLtoYLD  DALtoPER PERtoINC #>           <char> <int>      <num>     <num>     <num>    <num> #> 1:         China  1990 0.15101818 10.450506 0.7062324 20.75489 #> 2:         China  1990 0.12605741  8.187540 0.5649204 22.18755 #> 3:         China  1990 0.17373700 12.850767 0.8575658 19.33898 #> 4:         China  2005 0.08362720  3.988318 0.3092202 29.98444 #> 5:         China  2005 0.06973195  3.241955 0.2620949 30.86632 #> 6:         China  2005 0.09544737  4.676373 0.3531796 29.07491

title: Sample GBD export data — sample_gbd
text: small subset GBD 2019 data orofacial clefts (cause_id 644) containing 10 countries, 3 years (1990, 2005, 2019), 6 measures, Rate Number metrics, 3 sex categories, "Age-standardized" age group. Suitable testing examples.

title: Sample GBD export data — sample_gbd
code: sample_gbd

title: Sample GBD export data — sample_gbd
text: data.frame approximately 1,080 rows 16 columns: measure_id Integer. GBD measure identifier. measure_name Character. One : "YLLs (Years Life Lost)", "YLDs (Years Lived Disability)", "DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years)", "Deaths", "Incidence", "Prevalence". location_id Integer. GBD location identifier. location_name Character. Country region name. sex_id Integer. 1 = Male, 2 = Female, 3 = . sex_name Character. "Male", "Female", "". age_id Integer. GBD age group identifier. age_name Character. Age group label. cause_id Integer. GBD cause identifier. cause_name Character. Disease/condition name. metric_id Integer. 1 = Number, 2 = Percent, 3 = Rate. metric_name Character. "Number", "Percent", "Rate". year Integer. Calendar year. val Numeric. Point estimate. upper Numeric. Upper uncertainty bound. lower Numeric. Lower uncertainty bound.

title: Sample GBD export data — sample_gbd
text: GBD Results Tool https://vizhub.healthdata.org/gbd-results/

title: Standardize GBD measure names — standardize_measure_names
text: Converts verbose GBD measure names short forms.

title: Standardize GBD measure names — standardize_measure_names
code: standardize_measure_names(x)

title: Standardize GBD measure names — standardize_measure_names
text: x Character vector measure_name values.

title: Standardize GBD measure names — standardize_measure_names
text: Character vector shortened names.

title: Validate GBD data columns — validate_gbd_columns
text: Checks data.frame required columns QCI computation.

title: Validate GBD data columns — validate_gbd_columns
code: validate_gbd_columns(data, required = NULL)

title: Validate GBD data columns — validate_gbd_columns
text: data data.frame validate. required Character vector required column names. NULL, uses standard GBD columns.

title: Validate GBD data columns — validate_gbd_columns
text: Invisible TRUE. Side effect: aborts failure.

title: Check for required measures — validate_measures
text: Verifies data contains 6 GBD measures needed QCI.

title: Check for required measures — validate_measures
code: validate_measures(data)

title: Check for required measures — validate_measures
text: data data.frame measure_name column.

title: Check for required measures — validate_measures
text: Invisible TRUE. Side effect: aborts failure.

title: qci 0.1.0
text: Initial release. Complete pipeline raw GBD CSV exports normalized QCI scores (qci_pipeline()). Modular functions: qci_load(), qci_clean(), qci_ratios(), qci_pca(), qci_gdr(). Five visualization functions: plot_qci_map(), plot_gdr_map(), plot_qci_trend(), plot_qci_distribution(), plot_qci_scatter(). Gender Disparity Ratio (GDR) analysis. Export CSV Stata .dta formats. Bundled sample GBD data location type metadata. Getting started vignette.
